meanings.definition: The state or quality of being rotten.
meanings.sent1: The rottenness of the fruit made it inedible.
meanings.sent2: The kitchen was filled with the smell of rottenness.
meanings.sent3: The rottenness of the joke left everyone groaning.
meanings.sent4: The rottenness of corruption spread through the government.
meanings.sent5: The rottenness of the wood was evident in its crumbling texture.

meanings.definition: The condition of being decayed or decomposed.
meanings.sent1: The rottenness of the old building was visible in its crumbling walls.
meanings.sent2: The smell of rottenness filled the air in the abandoned house.
meanings.sent3: The rottenness of the banana peel made it a slippery hazard.
meanings.sent4: The rottenness of the fallen leaves added nutrients to the soil.
meanings.sent5: The rottenness of the food attracted flies to the garbage can.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being spoiled or putrid.
meanings.sent1: The rottenness of the milk was evident in its sour taste.
meanings.sent2: The kitchen was filled with the rottenness of the spoiled meat.
meanings.sent3: The rottenness of the prank made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The rottenness of the fish made it unsuitable for consumption.
meanings.sent5: The rottenness of the vegetables was noticeable in their foul smell.
